overview_of_class:
Analysis and design of solutions to transportation problems; introduction to selected operations research and statistical analysis techniques extensive use of case studies in urban transportation, intercity passenger transport, and freight movements. Offered jointly with CIV_ENV 371 - Introduction to Transportation Planning and Analysis.

COURSE OBJECTIVES /
*** Provide students with an understanding of the structure, organization
and operation of transportation systems and the political and social systems within which they operate.
*** Introduce students to principles and methods used for analysis and
prediction of the performance and utilization of transportation systems and changes to them.
*** Provide students the opportunity to use these analysis and forecasting methods in realistic case studies to assess the impacts of physical, operational and pricing changes to transportation systems to support the decision making about investment, operations and pricing.

TOPICS TO BE COVERED
*** Transportation systems concepts
*** Transportation planning
*** Travel demand forecasting
*** Transportation system modeling
*** Evaluation of alternatives and decision-makingPROJECTS: Homework and case studies using computer software.
For statistical analysis, SPSS;
For travel demand forecasting and system modeling, TransCad.
